verses.verse: The <S%H4428>king's<s%> <S%H3820>heart<s%> is in the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, as the <S%H6388>rivers<s%> of <S%H4325>water<s%>: he <S%H5186>turneth<s%> it whithersoever he <S%H2654>will<s%>.
Every <S%H1870>way<s%> of a <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H3477>right<s%> in his own <S%H5869>eyes<s%>: but the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H8505>pondereth<s%> the <S%H3826>hearts<s%>.
To <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H6666>justice<s%> and <S%H4941>judgment<s%> is more <S%H977>acceptable<s%> to the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> than <S%H2077>sacrifice<s%>.
An <S%H7312>high<s%> <S%H5869>look<s%>, and a <S%H7342>proud<s%> <S%H3820>heart<s%>, and the <S%H5215>plowing<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, is <S%H2403>sin<s%>.
The <S%H4284>thoughts<s%> of the <S%H2742>diligent<s%> tend only to <S%H4195>plenteousness<s%>; but of every one that is <S%H213>hasty<s%> only to <S%H4270>want<s%>.

The <S%H6467>getting<s%> of <S%H214>treasures<s%> by a <S%H8267>lying<s%> <S%H3956>tongue<s%> is a <S%H1892>vanity<s%> tossed to and fro <S%H5086>of<s%> them that <S%H1245>seek<s%> <S%H4194>death<s%>.
The <S%H7701>robbery<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> shall <S%H1641>destroy<s%> them; because they <S%H3985>refuse<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
The <S%H1870>way<s%> of <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H2019>froward<s%> and <S%H2054>strange<s%>: but as for the <S%H2134>pure<s%>, his <S%H6467>work<s%> is <S%H3477>right<s%>.

It is <S%H2896>better<s%> to <S%H3427>dwell<s%> in a <S%H6438>corner<s%> of the <S%H1406>housetop<s%>, than with a <S%H4079%H4066>brawling<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%> in a <S%H2267>wide<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%>.
The <S%H5315>soul<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H183>desireth<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%>: his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%> findeth no <S%H2603>favour<s%> in his <S%H5869>eyes<s%>.

When the <S%H3887>scorner<s%> is <S%H6064>punished<s%>, the <S%H6612>simple<s%> is made <S%H2449>wise<s%>: and when the <S%H2450>wise<s%> is <S%H7919>instructed<s%>, he <S%H3947>receiveth<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>.

The <S%H6662>righteous<s%> man wisely <S%H7919>considereth<s%> the <S%H1004>house<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>: but God <S%H5557>overthroweth<s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> for their <S%H7451>wickedness<s%>.
Whoso <S%H331>stoppeth<s%> his <S%H241>ears<s%> at the <S%H2201>cry<s%> of the <S%H1800>poor<s%>, he also shall <S%H7121>cry<s%> himself, but shall not be <S%H6030>heard<s%>.
A <S%H4976>gift<s%> in <S%H5643>secret<s%> <S%H3711>pacifieth<s%> <S%H639>anger<s%>: and a <S%H7810>reward<s%> in the <S%H2436>bosom<s%> <S%H5794>strong<s%> <S%H2534>wrath<s%>.
It is <S%H8057>joy<s%> to the <S%H6662>just<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%>: but <S%H4288>destruction<s%> shall be to the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%>.
The <S%H120>man<s%> that <S%H8582>wandereth<s%> out of the <S%H1870>way<s%> of <S%H7919>understanding<s%> shall <S%H5117>remain<s%> in the <S%H6951>congregation<s%> of the <S%H7496>dead<s%>.
He that <S%H157>loveth<s%> <S%H8057>pleasure<s%> shall be a <S%H4270>poor<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>: he that <S%H157>loveth<s%> <S%H3196>wine<s%> and <S%H8081>oil<s%> shall not be <S%H6238>rich<s%>.
The <S%H7563>wicked<s%> shall be a <S%H3724>ransom<s%> for the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>, and the <S%H898>transgressor<s%> for the <S%H3477>upright<s%>.
It is <S%H2896>better<s%> to <S%H3427>dwell<s%> in the <S%H776%H4057>wilderness<s%>, than with a <S%H4079%H4066>contentious<s%> and an <S%H3708>angry<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%>.

There is <S%H214>treasure<s%> to be <S%H2530>desired<s%> and <S%H8081>oil<s%> in the <S%H5116>dwelling<s%> of the <S%H2450>wise<s%>; but a <S%H3684>foolish<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> spendeth it <S%H1104>up<s%>.
He that <S%H7291>followeth<s%> after <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> and <S%H2617>mercy<s%> <S%H4672>findeth<s%> <S%H2416>life<s%>, <S%H6666>righteousness<s%>, and <S%H3519>honour<s%>.
A <S%H2450>wise<s%> man <S%H5927>scaleth<s%> the <S%H5892>city<s%> of the <S%H1368>mighty<s%>, and casteth <S%H3381>down<s%> the <S%H5797>strength<s%> of the <S%H4009>confidence<s%> thereof.
Whoso <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> and his <S%H3956>tongue<s%> <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> from <S%H6869>troubles<s%>.
<S%H2086>Proud<s%> and <S%H3093>haughty<s%> <S%H3887>scorner<s%> is his <S%H8034>name<s%>, who <S%H6213>dealeth<s%> in <S%H2087>proud<s%> <S%H5678>wrath<s%>.
The <S%H8378>desire<s%> of the <S%H6102>slothful<s%> <S%H4191>killeth<s%> him; for his <S%H3027>hands<s%> <S%H3985>refuse<s%> to <S%H6213>labour<s%>.
He <S%H183>coveteth<s%> <S%H8378>greedily<s%> all the <S%H3117>day<s%> long: but the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> and <S%H2820>spareth<s%> not.
The <S%H2077>sacrifice<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> is <S%H8441>abomination<s%>: how much more, when he <S%H935>bringeth<s%> it with a wicked <S%H2154>mind<s%>?
A <S%H3577>false<s%> <S%H5707>witness<s%> shall <S%H6>perish<s%>: but the <S%H376>man<s%> that <S%H8085>heareth<s%> <S%H1696>speaketh<s%> <S%H5331>constantly<s%>.
A <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H5810>hardeneth<s%> his <S%H6440>face<s%>: but as for the <S%H3477>upright<s%>, he <S%H995%H3559>directeth<s%> his <S%H1870>way<s%>.
There is no <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> nor <S%H8394>understanding<s%> nor <S%H6098>counsel<s%> against the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
The <S%H5483>horse<s%> is <S%H3559>prepared<s%> against the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H4421>battle<s%>: but <S%H8668>safety<s%> is of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
